Description: Terracotta mould-made protome of a woman. Fragment of right hand and breast from a large protome-bust. Terracotta figure of woman covering breast with right hand fragment. White coating preserved on some areas. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Protome bust (or ‘shoulder-bust’) of an early Classical Greek type. Fabric and style suggest an East Greece origin dated 500BC-425BC. Very similar, possibly from same mould as joining fragments from at least two protomes from the same mould were found at Naukratis in Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology. The fragments include two heads (NA350 joins NA355; NA354 joins NA353) and 5 joining body fragments (NA390 joins NA850, NA426, NA803 and NA509). Close parallels, probably from the same mould, from Lindos, Rhodes, dated 525BC to 400BC (Blinkenberg 1931, 591, pl.120, no.2525, who notes three copies from the same mould, Type B2) and in the British Museum from Rhodes, dated mid 5th century BC (Higgins 1954, no. 238, GR1885, 1213.41). Similar pieces, not from the same mould, were found at Olynthus dated to the early and late 5th century BC (Robinson 1952, pl.12, no.19; pl. 36, no.83; pl.38, nos 98 and 100). For context, function and details on protome parallels and fragments from Naukratis see protome records from Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA350, NA355, NA354, NA353, NA390, NA850, NA426, NA803 and NA509). Blinkenberg, C. 1931. Lindos. Fouilles de l’Acropole 1902-1914, I. Les petits objets, Berlin. Robinson, D. M. 1952. Olynthus XIV. Terracottas, lamps, and coins found in 1934 and 1938. Johns Hopkins University studies in archaeology. Baltimore, Johns Hopkins Press; London, Oxford University Press.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.087) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 83, nos 65, 68-70)
